hydrothermal-time model: A mathematical framework that quantifies the interplay between environmental temperature and moisture, allowing researchers to predict the optimal conditions under which a plant will germinate and thrive.

hydrothermal time: The cumulative effect of temperature and water availability on the development of a plant, measured by the interaction of heat and moisture over time, which affects the plant's ability to initiate growth and thrive in a specific environment.
